meanings.sent1: After retiring from the military, he civilianizes his career.
meanings.sent2: The company decided to civilianize its workforce by hiring more non-military employees.
meanings.sent3: The superhero's secret power is to civilianize into an ordinary person.
meanings.sent4: Her magic wand has the ability to civilianize any creature it touches.
meanings.sent5: The wizard cast a spell to civilianize the enchanted prince back into a commoner.

meanings.definition: To make civilian in nature or character.
meanings.sent1: Living in the peaceful countryside civilianizes his demeanor.
meanings.sent2: The new policy aims to civilianize the organization's culture.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous elf tried to civilianize his pranks, but they still caused chaos.
meanings.sent4: The artist's brush strokes civilianize the fierce dragon into a gentle creature.
meanings.sent5: The calming music has the power to civilianize even the most aggressive individuals.
